challenges.title: The High Ground
challenges.description: Have one team member enter a multi-story building and wave to the other teammate through a non-ground floor window. The other team member must wave back to complete the challenge.

challenges.title: Looney Lecture
challenges.description: Find a lecture hall available to the public and have one team member give a 1-minute lecture to the other about a topic related to the building you are currently in. Your lecture does not have to be factual.

challenges.title: Critter Companion
challenges.description:
Find 3 bugs and become friends with them.

For each bug, you must capture it on camera, introduce yourselves to the bug, and finally give it a name.

challenges.title: Flamingo
challenges.description: Both team members must stand still on one foot, without support, for 90 seconds non-stop.

challenges.title: Acting School
challenges.description:
Play 5 successful rounds of Charades. You may skip a word for any reason, however if more than 3 skips are used this challenge is vetoed.

Generate words using this website, on medium difficulty: [Charades Generator](https://itsgamenight.com/charades-generator/).

challenges.title: Bracket City
challenges.description:
Play The Atlantic Times’s "Bracket City" game [here](https://www.theatlantic.com/games/bracket-city/). You must get a score above 50, otherwise this challenge is automatically vetoed.

You may not look up answers, and you may not move while attempting this challenge.

challenges.title: Morse Message
challenges.description:
Use a Morse Code chart.

Have one team member walk 50 steps away, generate a random 5 letter word, then broadcast it in Morse Code using their phone’s flashlight.

The other team member must correctly decode the word to complete the challenge.

If you fail, generate a new word and try again.

challenges.title: Crafty Connections
challenges.description: Play The New York Times’s "Connections" game. Each set of words your team gets correct awards 4 tokens. You may not move or take transit while attempting this challenge.

challenges.title: Paper Racer
challenges.description: Acquire paper (or any thin, paper-like material) and construct a paper airplane.

challenges.title: Crewmate's Study
challenges.description: Find a book that contains the word “suspicious“, “among”, or “impostor”. The book’s title does not count.

challenges.title: Alarm Clock
challenges.description: Start a stopwatch and have one team member count to 30 seconds without assistance. If the stopwatch is within 1 second of 30 seconds when they stop, you succeed. Otherwise, you must restart.

challenges.title: Ample Parking
challenges.description: Find a parking lot with at least 5 adjacent empty spaces in a straight line.

challenges.title: Dry Out
challenges.description: Have a team member get their hands wet, then wait until they are fully dry.

challenges.title: Bottle Flipper
challenges.description: Acquire a disposable plastic bottle. Using this bottle, successfully perform a bottle flip.

challenges.title: Spitting Bars
challenges.description:
Have one team member rap “The Church of Bobandy” at full speed with the original track in the background.

You must successfully memorize and rap at least 3 verses without mistakes in lyrics or timing.

challenges.title: Cheapo
challenges.description: Purchase an item that costs $3 or less from a retailer or vending machine.

challenges.title: Elevator Innovator
challenges.description: Have one team member give an elevator pitch about elevators in an elevator.

challenges.title: Hammertime!
challenges.description: Find and touch 5 stop signs.

challenges.title: You Are Here
challenges.description: Find a physical map/directory and point our your current location on that map.

challenges.title: Quality Control
challenges.description: Find a marked location on Google Maps that’s rated below 4 stars and take a selfie in front of it. You may not rate any location yourself to fulfill the star requirement.

challenges.title: Piggyback
challenges.description: One team member must piggyback another team member for 100 steps. You may switch who is piggybacking at any time.

challenges.title: Letter List
challenges.description: Go to any retail establishment. Find and list 16 products that start with different letters of the alphabet.

challenges.title: Bookworm
challenges.description: Find books in a store or library whose authors' initials match each team member’s initials. (For example, John Doe must find a book written by someone with the initials “J.D.”.).

curses.title: Ransom!
curses.description: Your team must touch the fountain at Martha Piper Plaza before you are found, or else 5 minutes will be subtracted from your hiding time total.

curses.title: Unsheltered!
curses.description: Your team must stay outside for 10 minutes.

curses.title: Blindfolded!
curses.description:
One team member is blindfolded for 5 minutes.

(Be responsible and stay safe. If you can’t make a blindfold, keeping your eyes shut is acceptable.).

curses.title: Frozen!
curses.description: Your team is frozen in place for 3 minutes.

curses.title: Lockdown!
curses.description: If your team is inside a building, you are locked inside and may not leave for 10 minutes.

curses.title: Wordle!
curses.description:
Attempt a game of Wordle on [this website](https://wordleunlimited.org/). You may not move until you finish.

You are frozen for 30 seconds, multiplied by the amount of total entries made on the Wordle.
(i.e. 6 guesses = frozen for 3 mins).

curses.title: Touch Grass!
curses.description: You have 3 minutes to touch grass. If you fail, your team is frozen for 3 minutes.
